message.content: This question requires knowledge about electricity and conductors. Metal is the most commonly used material for transmitting power to a light bulb because it is a good conductor of electricity. Plastic, wood, and cloth are insulating materials and do not conduct electricity efficiently. Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer.

This question requires some basic knowledge about electrical conductivity. Metal is the best material to transmit power to a light bulb because it is a good conductor of electricity. Plastic, wood, and cloth are all insulators and do not allow electricity to flow through them easily, so they would not be suitable for transmitting power to a light bulb.

This question requires some basic understanding of electrical circuits. To transmit power to a light bulb, a conductive material is needed. Metal is a good conductor of electricity, so it can be used to transmit the power from the power source to the light bulb. Plastic, wood, and cloth are insulators and do not conduct electricity, so they would not be suitable for transmitting power to a light bulb.

This question requires basic knowledge about conducting materials that can transmit electrical power. Metals are good conductors of electricity and can transmit power to a light bulb. Option (A), plastic, is not a conductor of electricity. Option (C), wood, is also not a conductor of electricity. Option (D), cloth, is not a conductor of electricity either.

Plastic, wood, and cloth are all insulators, meaning they do not allow electricity to flow through them. Therefore, they cannot be used to transmit power to a light bulb.
